observations: Objects of the same color tend to cluster together.
The locations of the colored objects shift slightly between input and output, suggesting a translation or movement.
The shapes and colors of the objects are preserved.
The relative positions of the objects to each other is roughly maintained, suggesting a shifting of entire patterns.
Objects of the same color appear to move as a connected unit.
hypotheses: The colored shapes shift diagonally or orthogonally by a small offset.
The colored shapes are mirrored along the horizontal or vertical axis.
The colored shapes are rotated by 90 or 180 degrees.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: The colored shapes are mirrored along the horizontal or vertical axis.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: Mirroring would change the relative positions of the colored blocks, but they are preserved in the examples.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: The colored shapes are rotated by 90 or 180 degrees.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: Rotation changes the orientation of the blocks, which is not observed in the training examples.

selected_rule: The colored shapes shift down and to the right by a fixed amount.
step_plan: Identify colored shapes in the input grid.
Shift each colored shape down and to the right by one position.
